title: Did Trump end seven wars? US doesn't get full credit for his list
shortDescription: President Donald Trump says he ended seven wars and says people should be focused on that instead of the “Epstein hoax.” What 7 wars does he list?

title: Smithsonian sets up team to respond to Trump administration's demands
shortDescription: A letter Smithsonian Secretary Lonnie Bunch III sent to staff said the institution's "independence is paramount," according to news outlets.

title: Trump asks Supreme Court to save his tariffs – and do so quickly
shortDescription: President Trump is counting on the Supreme Court to save the centerpiece of his economic engine – sweeping tariffs.

title: MAHA road bump: As CDC turmoil continues, Trump hedges bet on vaccines
shortDescription: MAHA activists warned Trump that a move to shield pesticide companies could spell “peril for the Republican majority in the House" in 2026 midterms.

title: Is President Donald Trump a supporter of COVID-19 vaccines? It depends.
shortDescription: Despite now calling on drug companies to 'justify their success' in combating the virus, Trump has been a strong supporter of the vaccine in the past.

title: West Coast states rebuke Trump health moves
shortDescription: California, Oregon and Washington formed the West Coast Health Alliance to counter the Trump's administrations health policies and vaccine guidance.

title: House GOP creates new panel to reinvestigate Jan. 6
shortDescription: House Republicans voted to establish a new GOP-led subcommittee to reinvestigate the events of Jan. 6, despite a previous committee's findings.

title: Harvard wins a round against Trump as judge says funding cut was illegal
shortDescription: Harvard University was handed a win against the Trump administration's efforts to revoke $3 billion in federal funding.

title: Emotional Epstein accusers interrupted by Trump's military jet flyover
shortDescription: The White House said that the fighter jets were participating in maneuvers to honor a fallen Polish army pilot killed in a training exercise.

title: Victims of Jeffrey Epstein sexual abuse rally at Capitol Hill
shortDescription: Victims of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein joined House members to demand release of Epstein files in Washington, D.C., on September 3, 2025.

title: Once a Senate bachelor, Sen. Cory Booker gets engaged
shortDescription: Once one of the Senate's most eligible bachelors, New Jersey Sen. Cory Booker is now engaged to Alexis Lewis after dating Rosario Dawson.

title: Watch Eric Trump, sumo wrestler go toe-to-toe in Japan
shortDescription: Eric Trump and a high-ranking sumo wrestler went toe-to-toe during the businessman's recent trip to Tokyo, Japan. See video of the friendly duel.

title: Why is Trump sending troops to Chicago? Turns out he might hold off
shortDescription: President Donald Trump has repeatedly said he will send the National Guard into Chicago to address crime. Can he do that? When will it happen?

title: Trump claims Epstein files are a 'hoax'
shortDescription: President Donald Trump claimed the Jeffrey Epstein files are a 'Democrat hoax' despite Republican leaders supporting a petition to release files.

title: Trump accuses Jinping, Jong Un and Putin of conspiring against US
shortDescription: US President Donald Trump accused the leaders of China, North Korea, and Russia of conspiring against the US during their meeting in Beijing for the Victory Day military parade.​

title: What to know about the House bill to release 'Epstein files'
shortDescription: Here's what to know about the House fight aiming to force the Justice Department release its investigative records about Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Delaware judge tosses case claiming Trump conned Truth Social partners
shortDescription: A Delaware Chancery Court judge has dismissed a case against President Donald Trump over his media company.

title: 'Very, very impressive'. Trump responds to giant military parade in China
shortDescription: 'They were hoping I was watching,' Trump said of the mega event in China. It showcased China's advancing military might before 50,000 guests and spectators.

title: Chelsea Clinton passes on running for Congress. Is JFK's grandson in the mix?
shortDescription: Former first kid Chelsea Clinton is passing on a run to replace retiring New York Rep. Jerry Nadler as JFK's grandson, Jack Schlossberg, considers a run.

title: Trump demands 'proof' vaccines work amid CDC turmoil
shortDescription: President Donald Trump is questioning COVID-19 vaccines and demanding drug companies prove they work, amid changes at the CDC.

title: Trump says he may send National Guard to New Orleans over Chicago
shortDescription: President Trump suggested he may not send National Guard troops into Chicago and could instead target New Orleans in Republican-led Louisiana.
